summary: A novel set in the Jazz Age that tells the story of Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.
A dystopian novel about totalitarian surveillance, censorship, and the dangers of absolute political power.
A story about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South, told through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.
Follows the life of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who struggles with alienation and identity in postwar America.
A romantic novel exploring manners, upbringing, morality, and marriage in 19th-century England.
The quest of Captain Ahab to seek revenge on the giant white whale that bit off his leg.
A sweeping narrative about Russian society during the Napoleonic wars, blending history and fiction.
The adventure of Bilbo Baggins, who joins a group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.
An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron, the Dark Lord.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the young wizard and his adventures at Hogwarts.
A thriller combining art, history, and conspiracy as Robert Langdon uncovers secrets hidden by the Catholic Church.
A philosophical novel about a shepherd named Santiago who dreams of finding treasure in the pyramids of Egypt.
A dystopian story about a future society driven by technology, conditioning, and a loss of individuality.
A story of friendship and betrayal in Afghanistan, exploring themes of guilt, redemption, and family ties.
